Package arcade.core.util

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.core.util.Solver
  • public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility class implementing various numerical solvers.

    Implemented solvers include:

    • forward Euler: first-order method for ODEs
    • classic Runge–Kutta (RK4): fourth-order method for ODEs
    • Cash–Karp: adaptive step size method for ODEs
    • successive over-relaxation (SOR): variant of the Gauss–Seidel method for solving a linear system of equations

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  Solver.Equations
      Defines ODE equations for numerical solvers.
      static interface  Solver.Function
      Defines a continuous function.

      • euler

        public static double[] euler​(Solver.Equations eq,
                             double t0,
                             double[] y0,
                             double tf,
                             double h)
        Solves a system of ODEs using forward Euler.
        Parameters:
        eq - the system of equations
        t0 - the initial time
        y0 - the array of initial values
        tf - the final time
        h - the time step
        Returns:
        the array of final values

      • sor

        public static double[] sor​(double[][] mat,
                           double[] vec,
                           double[] x0)
        Solves a linear system of equations using successive over-relaxation with default sparse representation thresholding and maximum iterations.

        Based on matrix size, the algorithm with use a dense or sparse approach.

        Parameters:
        mat - the matrix of coefficients
        vec - the right-hand side vector
        x0 - the initial guess for the left-hand side vector
        Returns:
        the vector of final values

      • sor

        public static double[] sor​(double[][] mat,
                           double[] vec,
                           double[] x0,
                           int matrixThreshold,
                           int maxIters,
                           double tolerance)
        Solves a linear system of equations using successive over-relaxation.

        Based on matrix size, the algorithm with use a dense or sparse approach.

        Parameters:
        mat - the matrix of coefficients
        vec - the right-hand side vector
        x0 - the initial guess for the left-hand side vector
        matrixThreshold - the threshold for matrix size
        maxIters - the maximum number of iterations
        tolerance - the error tolerance
        Returns:
        the vector of final values

        the vector of final values

      • bisection

        public static double bisection​(Solver.Function func,
                               double a,
                               double b,
                               int maxIters)
        Finds root using bisection method.

        Root is found by repeatedly bisecting the interval and selecting the interval in which the function changes sign. If no root is found, the simulation will throw an ArithmeticException.

        Parameters:
        func - the function
        a - the lower bound on the interval
        b - the upper bound on the interval
        maxIters - the maximum number of iterations
        Returns:
        the root of the function

      • bisection

        public static double bisection​(Solver.Function func,
                               double a,
                               double b)
        Finds root using bisection method with default maximum iterations.

        Root is found by repeatedly bisecting the interval and selecting the interval in which the function changes sign. If no root is found, the simulation will throw an ArithmeticException.

        Parameters:
        func - the function
        a - the lower bound on the interval
        b - the upper bound on the interval
        Returns:
        the root of the function
